channel.title: Need help running server on Windows 7!
channel.description: hey, uhm well my problem is: I try to run my source (i copied it from old windows xp laptop to new windows 7 desktop pc) (stabbingscape 4.1) and ehm it wont work, help? I've noticed than my jdk files arent in "program files" but another map named "program files (86x)" maybe i have to change the path? anyone knows how? thnx

item.title: Need help running server on Windows 7!
item.dc:creator: @sergiypro sergiypro
item.description:
@sergiypro wrote:

my friend has windows 7. i set the path correctly on his comp, its still didnt work. weird.
also we tried to use direct location of the java.exe when running the file, still nothing

Read full topic

item.title: Need help running server on Windows 7!
item.dc:creator: @tman915 tman915
item.description:
@tman915 wrote:

try this for you client

[code]@ECHO OFF
title …
echo Welcome To …
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\javaw” -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar client
pause

[/code]

or this one

@echo off title ..... java -Xmx500m -cp .;./bin; EGUI

the first one should work.
lemme know what happens

Read full topic

Greetz

Read full topic
item.source: Need help running server on Windows 7!

item.title: Need help running server on Windows 7!
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

Its simple really. With your environment variables set properly, there’s no need to define the path to your JDK, your system already knows where to find everything needed.
You just stick this in a batch file: @echo off javac ./*.java pause

Without your environment variables set properly, you’ll have to call javac with quotes containing the direct path to JDK.
Stick this in a batch file:

"C:/Program Files (86x)/Java/JDK_vers.../javac.exe" ./*.java

Replace JDK_vers… with your version.

Read full topic
